altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: The first part of a Choral Service-Book for the circle of the whole year. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 87 items.

msItem.title: The first part of a Choral Service-Book for the circle of the whole year
msItem.rubric: ܟܕ ܬܟܝ̣ܠ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܕܡ̇ܣܬ̣ܝ̇ܥ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܡܢ ܚ̇ܝܠܐ ܐܠܗܝܐ. ܕܐܒܐ ܘܕܒܪܐ ܘܕܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܟ̇ܬܒ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܢܬ݁ܐ

rubric.fw: ܦܠܓܘܬܐ ܕܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܢܬܐ fol. 14 b
ܦܠܓܘܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ. ܕܟܪܘܟܝܐ. ܩܢ̈ܘܢܐ. ܘܩ̈ܠܐ. ܘܒܥ̈ܘܬܐ. ܘܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ. ܘܣ̈܏ܘܼ fol. 24 b
ܦܠܓܘܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܕܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܫ̣ܢܬܐ fol. 134 b

msItem.note: As these running titles indicate, the services consist of canons, chants, hymns and prayers for the various hours of the festivals and other holy days of the Church. The names of the authors are not attached to the canons, chants or hymns, though some of the madrāshē are ascribed on the margins to Ephraim (e.g. foll. 34 b, 50 a, 67 b, 83 a, 128 b, 138 b, 139 b, 143 b, 212 a and b); whereas bā’ǎvāthā are invariably assigned either to Ephraim or Jacob of Batnae, according to the metre in which they are composed.

msItem.title: Order of canons for the Dedication of the Church
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣܐ ܕܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ ܕܚܘܕܬ ܥܕܬܐ. ܕܠܐ ܐܬܟ̣ܬܒ ܒܕܘܟܬܗ
msItem.note: Not written in its proper place.

msItem.title: Second order for the same occasion
Order of propitiation and confession of faith
Canon for the same occasion, seventh tone
Order of the Consecration of the Church, on the first Sunday of the second Teshrīn
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܩܘܕܫ ܥܕܬܐ. ܒܚܕܒ܏ܫܒ ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܬܫܪܝܢ ܐܚܪܝBut on fol 9 b we read ܕܡ̇ܫܬܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܬܫܪܝܢ ܩܕܝܡ, "which is celebrated on the second Sunday of the first Teshrīn".

msItem.title: Order of the Dedication of the Church, celebrated on the third Sunday of the first Teshrīn
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܚܘܕܬ ܥܕܬܐ. ܕܡ̇ܫܬܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܕܬܠܬܐ ܕܬܫܪܝܢ ܩܕܝܡ

msItem.title: Order of propitiation and confession of faith, and against heresies; celebrated on the fourth Sunday of the first Teshrīn
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܚܘܣܝܐ ܘܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ. ܘܠܘܩܒܠ ܗܪ̈ܣܝܣ ܕܡ̇ܫܬܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܚܕ ܒܫܒܐ ܕܐܪܒܥܐ ܕܬܫܪܝܢ ܩܕܝܡ

msItem.title: The orthodox teachers (ܬܪ̈ܝܨܝ ܫܘܒܚܐ = ὀρθόδοξοι) are blessed by name
msItem.note: The orthodox teachers here comprise Ignatius, Athanasius, Basil, and Gregory (Nazianzen).
Diodorus (of Tarsus), Theodore (of Mopsuestia), Nestorius, Leo (the first, bishop of Rome), Marcion, Eutyches, Julian (of Halicarnassus),Narses, and Bar-saumā, are cursed as ܟ̈ܠܒܐ ܦܩܪ̈ܐ

msItem.title: Order of canons, hymns, madrāshē, and prayers for the Annunciation of Zacharias
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܩܢܘ̈ܢܐ. ܘܩ̈ܠܐ. ܘܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ. ܘܒ̈܏ܥܘ ܕܥܠ ܣܘܒܪܗ ܕܙܟܪܝܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Annunciation of Mary, the Mother of God
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܘܒܪܗ̇ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܡ݊ܪܝܡ

msItem.title: Order of the Visit of Mary to Elisabeth
Order of the Nativity of S. John the Baptist
Order of the Revelation of S. Joseph
Order of the festival (ἑορτὴ δεσποτική) of the Nativity of our Lord, etc.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܐܕܐ ܡܪܐܢܝܐ ܕܝܠ̣ܕܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܘܐܠܗܢ ܘܦܪܘܩܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܕܒܒܣܪ ܕܡܢ ܒܬܘܠܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܝ̇ܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܡ݊ܪܝܡ

msItem.title: Canticle concerning Mary and the Magi
Order of the Mother of God, which is celebrated after the Nativity of our Lord
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܫܬ݁ܡܠ̣ܐ ܒܬܪ ܝܠ̣ܕܗ ܕܡܪܢ

msItem.title: Order of the Infants, who were massacred by Herod
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܥܠ ܝ̈ܠ̣ܘܕܐ̣. ܕܐܬܩ̈ܛܠܘ ܡܢ ܗܪܘܕܣ

msItem.title: Order of the Decollation of S. John the Baptist
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܦܣ̣ܳܩ ܪܝܫܗ ܕܝܘܚܢܢ ܡ̇ܥܡܕܢܐ

msItem.title: Order of S. Stephen the first deacon and martyr
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܥܠ ܐܣܛܦܢܘܣ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܡܫ̈ܡܫܢܐ ܘܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܣܗ̈ܕܐ

msItem.title: Hymns and prayers of Nineveh, for three successive days
msItem.rubric: ܩ̈ܠܐ ܘܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ ܥܠ ܢܝܢܘܐ. ܕܡ̇ܫܬܡ̣ܠܝܢ ܒܗ̈ܠܝܢ ܬܠܬܐ ܝ̈ܘܡܬܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Meeting, i.e. of the Entrance of our Lord into the Temple, and of S. Simeon the Aged
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܐܰܦܳܘ݊ܦܰܢܛܻܝ ܐܘܟܝܬ ܕܡ̇ܥܠ̣ܬܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܠܗܝܟܠܐ ܘܕܫܡܥܘܢ
msItem.note: The Syriac word, ܐܰܦܳܘ݊ܦܰܢܛܻܝ, is a corruption of ὑπαπαντή.

msItem.title: Order of Mār Severus, or of any one Saint
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܣ݊ܐ݊ܘ݊ܪܐ. ܐܘ ܟܝܬ ܕܥܠ ܚܕ ܩܢܘܡܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Righteous and Priests, and of the Vigil of the Brethren
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܟܐ̈ܢܐ ܘܟܗ̈ܢܐ. ܘܒܫܗܪܐ ܕܐ̈ܚܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Dead in general
Order of hymns and prayers, in time of wrath (θεομηνία) and in scarcity of rain
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܩ̈ܠܐ ܘܒ̈܏ܥܘ ܕܡܫܬ݁ܡܠܐ ܒܙܒܢ ܪܘܓܙܐ ܘܒܚܣܝܪܘܬ ܡܛܪܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Decease of the Mother of God

physDesc.p: Vellum, 15 3/8 in. by 12 5/8, consisting of 235 leaves, some of which are slightly stained and soiled. The quires, 23 in number, are signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 24 to 39 lines.

item.p: Vellum, 15 3/8 in. by 12 5/8, consisting of 235 leaves, some of which are slightly stained and soiled. The quires, 23 in number, are signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 24 to 39 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a large, regular Estrangela, with a few Greek vowels. This volume was written A. Gr. 1318, A.D. 1007, as appears from the colophon of Add. 12,148.
The handwritings on foll. 5 b, 6, 7 a, and 235, are more modern; and the same hands have occasionally added marginal notes throughout the volume. See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: The Canon for the same occasion, seventh tone is in a more recent hand.
The Canon on Zacharias the priest is in a more recent hand.
On the margin of Fol. 193 a is written ϯⲠᾺΝΗ͂ⲦⲤΊⲤ
item.note: Both the Greek (ϯⲠᾺΝΗ͂ⲦⲤΊⲤ) and the Syriac (ܕܐܰܦܳܘ݊ܦܰܢܛܻܝ) words here are corruptions, the one of ὑπαπαντή, the other of ὑπάντησις. On fol. 208 a the word is written ܦܰܢܛܰܣܺܝܣ.

item.p: The Order of the Decease of the Mother of God is in a more modern hand.
On fol. 234 b, at the end of the Order of hymns and prayers, in time of wrath and in scarcity of rain, are the words,

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The above words are followed by an epigraph in heptasyllabic metre, naming the scribe Yeshūa'(see also fol. 72 b, in the ornament) and the person who paid for the writing of the book, Abū 'Alī Zakarīyā.

p.quote: ܫܘܼܒܚܐ ܡܢ ܟܠ ܠܬܠܬܐ. ܐܒܐ ܘܒܪܐ ܘܪܘܚܩ̣ܘܕܫܐ. ܬܠܝܬܝܐ ܚܲܣܐ ܚ̈ܘܒܘܗܝ. ܕܐܒܘܥܠܝ ܙܝܟܝܪܝ. ܘܡܐ ܕܟܣ̈ܝܬܐ ܡܬܓ̈ܠܝܢ. ܕܒܢ̈ܝܢܫܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ. ܒܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܝܟ ܚܲܦܐ ܣܢܝ̈ܬܗ. ܕܝܫܘܥ ܚܲܛܝܐ ܥܒܕܟ܀ ܐܡܝܢ܀

item.p: Below the epigraph there are several later notes, written across the foot of the page. First, a prayer for the said Abū 'Alī Zakarīyā the chief of the Tagritans in Egypt.

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܩܪܐ ܒܗܠܝܢ ܙܕܩ ܠܗ ܕܢܨ̇ܠ̣ܐ ܥܠ ܒܘܥܠܝ ܙܝܟܪܝ ܪܝܫܐ ܕܬܓܪ̈ܝܬܢܝܐ ܕܗܘܘ ܒܡܨܪܝܡ

item.p: The second note at the foot of fol. 234 b is a prayer for the priest 'Abda and for Abū 'Al̄ī.

p.quote: ܟܠ ܐܝܢܐ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܟ̈ܬܒܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܢܨܲܠܐ ܥܠ ܥܒ̣ܕܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܘܕܝܪܝܐ ܢܟܦܐ. ܗ̇ܘ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܗ̣ܘܬ݀ ܠܗ ܝܲܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܥܠ ܫܘܡܠܝܐ ܕܗܠܝܢ ܟܬ̈ܒܐ ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܠܗ ܘܠܥܢ̣̈ܝܕܘܗܝ̣ ܐܡܝܢ. ܘܠܗ̇ܘ ܐܪܟܘܢܐ ܕܪܫܝܡ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܝܗܒ ܐܓܪܐ ܘܐܬܟܬܒܘ

item.p: The third note at the foot of fol. 234 b is by one Peter Bartellāyā (i.e. from ܒܪܛܠܠܝ ܩܣܛܪܐ or بَرْطٌلَّي, in the district of Mosul).

p.quote: ܟܠ ܡܢ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܒܚܘܒܐ ܡܫܝ̣ܚܝܐ ܥܠ ܥܒ̣ܕܟܘܢ ܦܐܛܪܘܣ ܚܛܝ̣ܐ ܕܡܬܕܠܠ ܒܪܛܠܝ̣ܐ. ܘܟܠ̣ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܢ̇ܛܪ. ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ. ܘܟܠ ܕܠ̇ܚܐ ܠܗܠܝܢ ܣܘܪ̈ܛܐ ܢܬܠ̣ܚܐ ܫܡܗ ܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܒܝܡ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ. ܐܡܝܢ

item.p: The last note at the foot of fol. 234 b has the name of the priest Joseph Sīmandāyā.

p.quote: ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܠܝܘܣܦ ܣܝܡܢܕܝܐ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܐܡܝܢ

item.p: The above-mentioned Peter Bartellāyā has also entered his name on the margin of fol. 92 a, as follows.

p.quote: ܒܗܝܡܢ ܨ̇ܠܘ ܥܠ ܦܛܪܘܣ ܚܛܝܐ ܕܡܢ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܡܘܼܨܠ ܕܡܬܕܠܠ ܒܪܛܠܝܐ

item.p: On the margin of fol. 134 a is written, though rather indistinctly, the name of another Peter.

p.quote: ܨܠܘ ܥܠ ܦܛܪܘܣ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܣܟܢܐ ܘܡܦܠܦܠ ܒܣ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܕܡܬܕܠܠ ܟܝܢܘܝܐ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: added decoNote elements for decorations
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
CHANGED: deleted empty elements and attributes
CHANGED: Added project metadata; metadata from Wright Decoder; msItem, handDesc, and additions enumeration; Wright Taxonomy designation
